item.title: Enable coredump on ubuntu 16.04
item.description: Coredump file is useful for debuging program crash. This post will show several settings related to coredump. Enable coredump If you run program from shell , enable coredump via unlimit -c unlimitedï¼Œ then check unlimit -a | grep core, if it shows unlimited, coredump is enabled for your current session. If your program is hosted by systemd, you need to edit your program’s service unit file’s [Service] section, add LimitCORE=infinity to enable coredump.
